prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: B4 Continuum
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: On this band, we requiere ~ 0.2'' of resolution in order to measure the dust spectral index beta (with the frequency at 340 GHz). This will also allow us to separate the optically thin regions and the otically thicks ones.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We use the full continuum setup in order to have the maximun sensitivity of the dust thermal emission. No molecular lines is observed at this frequency.

In this Band, 0.2'' of resolution is sufficient to measure the spectral index beta in function of the radius and to determine the optically thin and optically regions in order to define the dust temperature and disk density.

We obtain for our source a S/n > 10 for the estimated peak flux continuum, which is suficicent. In our simulations (Boehler et al 2013). We showed that a noise of 20 microJy was enough to measure the dust settling. Nevertheless, half an hour on each source is important in order to have a good UV coverage.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: B4 Continuum : Gomez hamburger
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: On this band, we requiere ~ 0.2'' of resolution in order to measure the dust spectral index beta (with the frequency at 340 GHz). This will also allow us to separate the optically thin regions and the otically thicks ones.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We use the full continuum setup in order to have the maximun sensitivity in the dust thermal emission. No molecular lines is observed at this frequency.

In this Band, 0.2'' of resolution is sufficient to measure the spectral index beta in function of the radius and to determine the optically thin and optically regions in order to define the dust temperature and density.

We obtain for our source a S/n > 10 for the estimated peak flux continuum, which is sufisicent. In our simulations (Boehler et al 2013). We showed that a noise of 20 microJy was enough to measure the dust settling. Nevertheless, half an hour on each source is important in order to have a good UV coverage.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: B7 continuum Oph/FLying
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: The goal is to measure the dust scale height in protoplanetary disks. For this, we need a resolution of 0.1'' to resolve verticaly the dust vertical distribution. Also, we want to measure the thermalized lines of 12CO J=3-2 et 13C0 J = 3-2 to measure the gas temperatures.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We want to measure the 12 CO line to know the dust temperature and density. On the others bands, we want to have the maximun sensitivity and we choose the widest range.
The angular resolution is required to measure the settling. This was verified by simulations. The largest angular scale to be recovered is here typical of edge-on disks.
The required sensitivity was derived from simulations. Time can be adjusted on one source compared to the other if needed.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: B7 GoHam
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: The goal is to measure the dust scale height in protoplanetary disks. For this, we need a resolution of 0.1'' to resolve verticaly the dust vertical distribution. Also, we want to measure the thermalized lines of 12CO J=3-2 et 13C0 J = 3-2 to measure the gas temperatures.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We want to detect the CO thermalized line to measure the gas density and use for the others bands the widest range of frequency to have the maximum sensitivity.
We need 0.1'' of angular resolution to resolve the vertical aspect of the disc.
The required sensitivity was derived from simulations. Time can be adjusted on one source compared to the other if needed.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose to directly constrain the dust settling in 3 protoplanetary disks, differing by their size, their age and their central star. For this, we will use the method in Boehler et al. (2013) which consists, thanks to the high angular resolution and sensitivity of ALMA, to compare directly the dust scale height with the gas one, considered in hydrostatic equilibrium. With an angluar resolution of 0.1'', we can constrain the dust scale height by a factor 3 below the gas one.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Circumstellar disks, exoplanets and the solar system

prp:PrincipalInvestigator.prp:organisation: Centro de Radioastronomia y Astrofisica, Universidad Nacional Autonomo de Mexico

prp:CoInvestigator.prp:organisation: IRAM Grenoble, Institute of Millimetric Radioastronomy (IRAM)
